meanings.definition: A spiral shape or spiral shell
meanings.sent1: The seashell had beautiful caracoles on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The tornado formed a massive caracoles in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted delicate caracoles on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts spiraled like caracoles, never settling on one idea.
meanings.sent5: The caracoles of the staircase added an elegant touch to the building.

meanings.definition: A type of dance step involving a spiral movement
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the dancers executed flawless caracoles.
meanings.sent2: The traditional dance included intricate caracoles that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent3: The dance instructor taught the students how to master the caracoles with grace.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were as smooth as flowing caracoles.
meanings.sent5: The caracoles in the routine added a dynamic element to the performance.

meanings.definition: A type of snail or mollusk with a spiral shell
meanings.sent1: In the garden, we found colorful caracoles crawling on the leaves.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the anatomy of the caracoles found in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh caracoles from the farm.
meanings.sent4: The caracoles in the aquarium moved slowly, exploring their surroundings.
meanings.sent5: Children enjoyed observing the caracoles in the science class.
